conclusion: Liquid will flow out from points A, B, and C.
Liquid from point A flows downward.
Liquid from point A encounters a baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point A continues to flow downward and to the right.
Liquid from point A reaches the bottom right area of the system.
Liquid from point A flows into container E.
Liquid from point B flows downward.
Liquid from point B encounters a baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from point B continues to flow downward and to the left.
Liquid from point B reaches the bottom left area of the system.
Liquid from point B flows into container D.
Liquid from point C flows downward.
Liquid from point C encounters a baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from point C continues to flow downward and to the left.
Liquid from point C reaches the bottom left area of the system.
Liquid from point C flows into container D.
Baffles play a crucial role in directing the flow of the liquid.
Direction of the baffles determines whether the liquid will flow to the left or right.
Final position of the liquid depends on the cumulative effect of the baffles and the overall layout of the system.
Liquid from point A will flow into container E; liquid from points B and C will flow into container D.
